com.milk.uberchat.base
Class BaseSystem

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseEntity
        |
        +--com.milk.uberchat.base.BaseSystem
All Implemented Interfaces:
ChatEntity, ChatSystem, Commandable, Editable
Direct Known Subclasses:
ICBSystem, IRCSystem, SBSystem
public abstract class BaseSystem
extends BaseEntity
implements ChatSystem

This is an abstract base class that provides a lot of what all ChatSystem implementors need. It deals with automatically sending a lot of the needed events, such as for identity creation and destruction, etc.

Note that BaseSystem completely takes care of setting the description for its ChatEntity nature, so subclasses should not call BaseEntity.setDescription(). Unfortunately, Java doesn't provide a way to specify this restriction programatically. It just sucks that way sometimes.

Author:
Dan Bornstein, danfuzz@milk.com
, Copyright 1999 Dan Bornstein, all rights reserved.

getEditor

public final Editor getEditor()
Get the editor for this system. The editor for a BaseSystem is in fact the editor for the internal ChatSystemTemplate object.

Specified by:
getEditor in interface Editable
Returns:
non-null; the editor

systemConnected

protected final void systemConnected()
Inform the system that it has been connected. This will set the state appropriately and will send out a systemConnected event.

systemDisconnected

protected final void systemDisconnected()
Inform the system that it has been disconnected. This will set the state appropriately and will send out a systemDisconnected event. Additionally, if there are any identities that haven't been removed, this will cause them to be removed.

addIdentity

protected final void addIdentity(ChatIdentity identity)
Add a new identity to the system. This will automatically send an identityAdded event to the listeners of this system. Note that it is only valid to add an identity to a connected system.

Parameters:
identity - the identity to add

removeIdentity

protected final void removeIdentity(ChatIdentity identity)
Remove an identity from the system. This will automatically send an identityRemoved event to the listeners of this system.

Parameters:
identity - the identity to remove

removeAllIdentities

protected final void removeAllIdentities()
Remove all the identities from the system. This means that the system has been disconnected. This will automatically send an identityRemoved event for each of the (former) identities of the system.

setTemplate

protected final void setTemplate(ChatSystemTemplate template)
Set the template to associate with this system. BaseSystem will never hand this out directly, rather it always hands out a copy, so subclasses should feel free to edit the template at will and not worry about external hands messing with things.

Parameters:
template - the template to associate with this system

canonicalUserName

public abstract java.lang.String canonicalUserName(java.lang.String orig)
BaseSystem leaves it up to the subclass to decide how to canonicalize user names.

Specified by:
canonicalUserName in interface ChatSystem
Parameters:

Specified by:
canonicalChannelName in interface ChatSystem
Parameters:

Returns:

systemConnect

protected abstract void systemConnect()
BaseSystem calls this method when it actually wants a connection to happen. It will only call this if the system is not actually connected. By the time this method is called, a systemConnecting event will have already been sent out. Once the connection succeeds or fails, the subclass should call systemConnected() or systemDisconnected(), respectively.

systemDisconnect

protected abstract void systemDisconnect()
BaseSystem calls this method when it actually wants to disconnect the system. It will only call this if the system is actually connected. By the time this method is called, a systemDisconnecting event will have already been sent out. Once the connection is finally terminated, the subclass should call systemDisconnected().

listenerAdded

protected void listenerAdded(java.util.EventListener listener)
BaseEntity calls this method when a listener has been added.

Overrides:
listenerAdded in class BaseEntity
Parameters:
listener - the listener that was added

Parameters:
listener - the listener that was added

nameChanged

protected void nameChanged()
BaseEntity calls this when the name and/or canonical name of this object changes. We use this to re-make the description, since it is in part based on the name.

Overrides:
nameChanged in class BaseEntity

Set the description of this system, based on the name and connection status.
